results.title: Suppression of tooth movement-induced sclerostin expression using beta-adrenergic receptor blockers.
results.text_hl: This study aimed to compare the effects of the beta-adrenergic receptor (beta-AR) blockers @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (@GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1-AR@@@ blocker), @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@butoxamine@@@ (beta2-AR blocker) and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (non-selective beta-AR blocker) on @<m>DISEASE_Tooth_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014076 @@@tooth movement@@@ in spontaneously @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (SHR) with sympathicotonia.

citations.NLM: Uchibori S, Sekiya T, Sato T, Hayashi K, Takeguchi A, Muramatsu R, Ishizuka K, Kondo H, Miyazawa K, Togari A, Goto S. Suppression of tooth movement-induced sclerostin expression using beta-adrenergic receptor blockers. Oral Dis. 2020 Apr;26(3):621-629. PMID: 31943597
